columns.name: association_id
columns.description: The ID created by the system when you create an association.

columns.name: association_name
columns.description: The Name of association.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the association.

columns.name: document_name
columns.description: The name of the Systems Manager document.

columns.name: date
columns.description: The date when the association was made.

columns.name: compliance_severity
columns.description: A cron expression that specifies a schedule when the association runs.

columns.name: apply_only_at_cron_interval
columns.description: By default, when you create a new associations, the system runs it immediately after it is created and then according to the schedule you specified. Specify this option if you don't want an association to run immediately after you create it. This parameter is not supported for rate expressions.

columns.name: association_version
columns.description: The association version.

columns.name: automation_target_parameter_name
columns.description: Specify the target for the association. This target is required for associations that use an Automation document and target resources by using rate controls.

columns.name: document_version
columns.description: The version of the document used in the association.

columns.name: instance_id
columns.description: The ID of the instance.

columns.name: last_execution_date
columns.description: The date on which the association was last run.

columns.name: last_successful_execution_date
columns.description: The last date on which the association was successfully run.

columns.name: last_update_association_date
columns.description: The date when the association was last updated.

columns.name: schedule_expression
columns.description: A cron expression that specifies a schedule when the association runs.

columns.name: max_concurrency
columns.description: The maximum number of targets allowed to run the association at the same time.

columns.name: max_errors
columns.description: The number of errors that are allowed before the system stops sending requests to run the association on additional targets.

columns.name: sync_compliance
columns.description: The mode for generating association compliance. You can specify AUTO or MANUAL.

columns.name: overview
columns.description: Information about the association.

columns.name: output_location
columns.description: An S3 bucket where you want to store the output details of the request.

columns.name: parameters
columns.description: A description of the parameters for a document.

columns.name: status
columns.description: The status of the association. Status can be: Pending, Success, or Failed.

columns.name: targets
columns.description: A cron expression that specifies a schedule when the association runs.

columns.name: target_locations
columns.description: The combination of AWS Regions and AWS accounts where you want to run the association.
